intro: Trismeria argentea, commonly known as silver trismeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-green foliage and showy yellow flowers with red stamens. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils.
